name: diethyl 4-(4-fluorophenyl)-2,6-dihydroxy-2,6-bis(trifluoromethyl)piperidine-3,5-dicarboxylate
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3735
Reason: 4-Fluorophenyl and trifluoromethyl groups increase the melting point due to increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The fluorine substituents also introduce a strong dipole moment, which raises the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The piperidine ring introduces a rigid structure and potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at +20 degrees Celsius. The carboxylate group can participate in hydrogen bonding, which might lower the melting point by approximately -10 degrees Celsius. The presence of two fluorine substituents can also increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces, estimated at +20 degrees Celsius.
